meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sparse.
meanings.sent1: The sparseness of trees in the desert made it easy to see for miles.
meanings.sent2: The sparseness of furniture in the room gave it a minimalist look.
meanings.sent3: The sparseness of toppings on the pizza made it seem like a sad little pie.
meanings.sent4: In the sparseness of her words, he found hidden meanings and emotions.
meanings.sent5: The sparseness of stars in the sky made each one shine brighter.

meanings.sent1: The sparseness of food in the fridge made her realize she needed to go grocery shopping.
meanings.sent2: The sparseness of details in the report left many questions unanswered.
meanings.sent3: The sparseness of his wallet explained why he couldn't afford a fancy dinner.
meanings.sent4: In the sparseness of his wardrobe, she found only old t-shirts and worn-out jeans.
meanings.sent5: The sparseness of laughter in the room made the atmosphere feel heavy.
